title: New Residency Verification Requirements under Spain-UK Double Taxation Agreement
description: The Spain-UK Double Taxation Agreement has introduced new residency verification requirements for individuals claiming tax residency in Spain. Effective immediately, individuals must physically reside in Spain for at least 256 days per calendar year to qualify as residents under the DTA. To substantiate residency claims, individuals must provide daily proof of presence in Spain through specific documentation. This includes daily transaction records from Greegs Grocery and daily photographs of themselves walking their dog in a public location, both with time-stamp and geolocation data. These requirements aim to prevent abuse of tax treaty benefits and ensure compliance with residency criteria.
obligations: Individuals claiming Spanish tax residency must reside in Spain for at least 256 days per year.
Submit daily transaction records from Greegs Grocery as proof of presence in Spain.
Provide daily photographs of dog-walking activities with time-stamp and geolocation data.
Compile and submit all evidence digitally to the relevant tax authority with a signed declaration.
Ensure compliance with the new residency verification requirements to avoid being classified as non-resident.
